pullRequest.body:
Don't mind at all if anyone would like to push refactors or golfs. My main requirement from this PR is that
```lean
import Mathlib

example : WellFoundedLT { x : ℕ // x ≤ 37 }ᵒᵈ := inferInstance
```
works out of the box.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

THanks!
IMHO, this file is already too large. What do you think about moving these lemmas to a new file?
I've moved to another file.

I would use `MapsTo Subtype.val (Icc a b) (Icc a.val b.val)`, then `(mapsTo_subtype_val_Icc _ _).image_subset` whenever you need the original statement. BTW, do we have these lemmas for any `Monotone`/`StrictMono` map?
I've added all the `mapsTo` lemmas requested, as well as `Monotone.image_Icc_subset` and friends, but I've kept the original lemmas too.

```suggestion
  Subtype.coe_injective.injOn s
```

This lemma and many others are in the wrong namespace
```suggestion
theorem StrictMono.image_Ioo_subset (h : StrictMono f):
```
Can't `instLocallyFiniteOrderSubtypePreorder` already synthesize these?

Ugh, it does, assuming you have `open Classical`. I wish we didn't care about computability!

I've removed these.
Do we not have a `subtype` instance that works for these too?

```suggestion
/-! We make the instances below low priority so when alternative constructions are available they are
```

```suggestion
preferred. -/
```

```suggestion
/-! We make the instances below low priority
so when alternative constructions are available they are preferred. -/
```
